abstract.t: This document describes the Dynamic Virtual Network Engine (DVNE)protocol. The DVNE protocol is a signaling protocol between avirtual network node (the DVNE Client) and a configuration server(the DVNE Mediator). The DVNE protocol is used to authenticate thenodes in a Virtual Network and assist them to setup and release VPNconnections directly among themselves.A DVNE clients can be located anywhere in a private or publicnetwork, directly connected or behind one or more levels of NAT. TheDVNE protocol performs client authentication, peer discovery, virtualnetwork address management, and provides all parameters necessary toenable the clients setup a secure VPN connection. The protocol doesnot explicitly setup the VPN connection itself. It only enables theclients to be able to directly setup the VPN connection themselves.
